events.title: Catholic cardinals warn US foreign policy under Trump risks global suffering
events.description: Church leaders cite Greenland threats, Venezuela action and aid cuts as undermining human dignity and peace Three cardinals in the US Catholic church have criticized the Trump administration ’s foreign policy, saying its push to obtain or otherwise seize Greenland , recent military action in Venezuela , and cuts to humanitarian aid risk “destroying international relations and plunging the world into incalculable suffering”. “Our country’s moral role in confronting evil around the world, sustaining the right to life and human dignity, and supporting religious liberty are all under examination,” said a joint statement from Blase Cupich, Robert McElroy and Joseph Tobin, respectively the archbishops of Chicago, Washington DC and Newark, New Jersey. The Associated Press contributed Continue reading...

events.title: Chilean president declares state of catastrophe as wildfires kill at least 18
events.description: Fires blaze through 8,500 hectares, forcing 50,000 people to evacuate as firefighters struggle to extinguish flames Wildfires raging across central and southern Chile have killed at least 18 people, scorched thousands of hectares of forest and destroyed scores of homes, authorities said, as the South American country swelters under a heatwave. Chile’s president, Gabriel Boric, declared a state of catastrophe in the country’s central Biobío region and the neighbouring Ñuble region, about 500km (300 miles) south of Santiago, the capital. Continue reading...

events.title: Guatemala declares state of emergency after eight police officers killed in prison gang violence
events.description: President announces 30-day order after inmates also took 46 people hostage at three prisons Guatemala’s president has declared a 30-day nationwide state of emergency to combat criminal gangs after authorities accused them of killing eight police officers and holding hostages at three prisons. The killings occurred in the capital, Guatemal City, and surrounding areas a day after gang-affiliated inmates took 46 people hostage in the three prisons across the country to demand incarcerated gang leaders be moved to lower-security facilities. Continue reading...

events.title: Men charged with contract killing of Indigenous leader to go on trial in Peru
events.description: Prosecution over death of Quinto Inuma Alvarado seen as test of ability to curb attacks on environmental defenders Five men are due to go on trial on Tuesday over the killing of an Amazonian Indigenous leader, in a legal case that could test whether Peru can hold perpetrators accountable for violence linked to illegal logging and drug trafficking in one of the world’s most dangerous regions for environmental defenders. The Kichwa tribal leader Quinto Inuma Alvarado was killed on 29 November 2023, after repeatedly denouncing illegal activity within his community’s territory. Continue reading...

events.title: Will AI kickstart a new age of nuclear power?
events.description: The rapidly expanding use of artificial intelligence worldwide is putting electrical grids under huge pressure and many believe that, to meet that need without contributing to the climate crisis, a full-scale expansion of nuclear energy is essential.

events.title: Rising hunger and displacement pose growing economic risk, UN tells Davos
events.description: As global leaders gather at the World Economic Forum in Davos this week, UN agencies are warning that rising hunger and displacement are not only humanitarian emergencies but growing threats to global economic stability.

events.title: Sudan: Atrocities ‘repeated town by town’, ICC prosecutor tells UN Security Council
events.description: Atrocities in Sudan’s Darfur region are spreading from town to town in an organized campaign of violence that includes mass executions, rape and ethnic targeting, amounting to war crimes and crimes against humanity, the prosecutor of the International Criminal Court told the UN Security Council on Monday.

events.title: Uganda’s president calls opponents 'terrorists' in victory speech
events.description: Yoweri Museveni wins seventh term but poll criticised by observers and rights groups over repression of opposition and internet blackout Uganda’s president, Yoweri Museveni, fresh from winning a seventh term in office at 81, said on Sunday that the opposition were “terrorists” who had tried to use violence to overturn the election results. Official results showed Museveni winning a landslide with 72% of the vote , but the poll was criticised by African election observers and rights groups due to the heavy repression of the opposition and an internet blackout. Continue reading...

events.title: Australia toughens its gun laws following Bondi Beach terrorist attack
events.description: In the wake of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack last month, Australia toughened its gun laws on Tuesday.

events.title: Iran's top diplomat issues most direct threat yet to US
events.description: Iran's foreign minister has issued a direct threat against the United States, warning of retaliation if attacked

events.title: Armed militias fire heavy machine guns through Tehran streets in deadly night attacks
events.description: Iran protests entered day 24 with 4,519 confirmed deaths. Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei backs security forces amid nationwide demonstrations.

events.title: Iranian soldier sentenced to death for refusing to fire on protesters during nationwide unrest
events.description: Iranian soldier Javid Khales was reportedly sentenced to death for refusing orders to shoot protesters during nationwide unrest, a human rights group says.

events.title: Spain’s train crash death toll rises to 42, casts a shadow on world-class rail system
events.description: The death toll in a train crash in southern Spain rose to at least 42, local officials said on Tuesday as Spain started a three-day period of national mourning. The incident has cast a pall over one of the nation’s symbols of success as Spanish officials say they are still at a loss to understand what went wrong Sunday night.

events.title: Anthony Joshua's driver appears in court over fatal crash in Nigeria
events.description: A driver charged in connection with a fatal crash in Nigeria, which killed two passengers and injured boxer Anthony Joshua, has appeared in court.

events.title: Cold and dark: UN rights chief condemns Russian strikes on Ukraine’s power grid
events.description: Russian attacks on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure have cut heat, electricity and water to hundreds of thousands of civilians in freezing winter conditions, prompting the UN human rights chief to denounce the strikes as “cruel” and a clear violation of international law.

events.title: Israeli UN ambassador sends stark warning to Iran amid growing unrest
events.description: Israel warns Iran not to test its military readiness amid tensions over ballistic missiles and nuclear capabilities following summer 2025 operations.

events.title: Mozambique floods heighten disease, malnutrition risks – UN agencies
events.description: Catastrophic flooding across Mozambique is devastating lives and livelihoods, sharply increasing the risk of disease outbreaks and malnutrition, while also forcing dangerous wildlife – including crocodiles – into flooded urban areas, the UN warned on Tuesday.

events.title: World Economic Forum boots Iranian foreign minister from Davos summit amid deadly crackdown on protesters
events.description: World Economic Forum withdraws Iranian foreign minister's Davos invitation amid deadly nationwide protests that have killed thousands of civilians.

events.title: Barcelona rail crash kills 1 days after deadly train wreck in Spain’s south
events.description: Official says 37 people injured, as Spain observes three days of mourning for 42 killed in earlier train collision.

events.title: Students return to Brown University amid questions over security policies that enabled mass shooting
events.description: Brown University students return to campus after deadly shooting that killed two students, injured nine. New security measures implemented amid concerns.

events.title: ‘Brazen’ political influence of rich laid bare as wealth of billionaires reaches $18.3tn, says Oxfam
events.description: Governments opting for oligarchy while brutally repressing protests over austerity and lack of jobs, charity report says The world saw a record number of billionaires created last year, with a collective wealth of $18.3tn (£13.7tn), while global efforts stalled in the fight against poverty and hunger. Oxfam’s annual survey of global inequality has revealed that the number of billionaires surpassed 3,000 for the first time during 2025. Since 2020, their collective wealth grew by 81%, or $8.2tn, which the charity claims would be enough to eradicate global poverty 26 times over. Continue reading...

events.title: Spain: Driver killed, passengers injured in new train crash
events.description: A commuter train has crashed near Barcelona in northeastern Spain. The accident comes days after a deadly high-speed train collision in Andalusia killed 42.

events.title: ‘Alarming’ increase in use of death penalty last year, despite global trend towards abolition
events.description: Despite a downward trend in the use of the death penalty globally, 2025 saw an ‘alarming’ increase in the number of executions in a small number of retentionist countries, the UN human rights office (OHCHR) warned on Monday.

events.title: Amid Sudan’s humanitarian crisis, Chad shows ‘act of solidarity’
events.description: In war-torn Sudan, local communities say they don’t have enough settlements for the internally displaced, few solutions for women who have suffered sexual violence – and there’s a lack of aid available for people with disabilities.

events.title: Illegal immigrant accused in DUI crash that killed college soccer player, girlfriend: report
events.description: Immigration detainer issued for suspect accused of fatal DUI crash that killed two young people, including college student-athlete in North Carolina.

events.title: Nationals hold crisis meeting on Coalition’s future after three senators resign over hate speech laws
events.description: Ross Cadell, Bridget McKenzie and Susan McDonald breached shadow cabinet solidarity rules, challenging authority of Sussan Ley and Nationals leader David Littleproud Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The Nationals will debate whether to quit Sussan Ley’s shadow cabinet and effectively blow up the Coalition at a crisis meeting trigged by a split over Labor’s hate speech laws. Nationals MPs are meeting virtually from 6pm for emergency talks after three frontbenchers resigned following a decision to cross the floor to oppose the bill. Continue reading...

events.title: Almost half of Kyiv without heat, power, after Russian attack
events.description: An overnight Russian bombardment on Kyiv left thousands of residential buildings and parliament without heating and water in -14C temperatures on Tuesday, just as the Ukrainian capital was scrambling to restore vital utilities destroyed in earlier attacks. The barrage of hundreds of drones and missiles, which targeted energy facilities across Ukraine, killed at least one 50-year-old man near Kyiv. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.

events.title: Myanmar begins defence in landmark genocide case at UN World Court
events.description: Myanmar on Friday rejected allegations of genocide against the Rohingya minority, telling the International Court of Justice (ICJ) that the Gambia’s case rests on “unsubstantiated allegations,” as public hearings continued in a landmark case on the application of the Genocide Convention.

events.title: Rights groups warn on Israeli abuse of Palestinian prisoners
events.description: A new report has published harrowing testimonies by Palestinians who were released as part of the Israel-Hamas ceasefire deal. Meanwhile, rights activists are worried that Israel is now considering the death penalty.

events.title: Unrecognized pain: Most Halabja Massacre survivors have PTSD
events.description: A new report finds ongoing trauma affects survivors of a 1988 chemical weapons attack on Kurdish Iraqis in Halabja and nearby communities, highlighting the need for better health and support services.

events.title: Thousands rally across US against Trump policies on inauguration anniversary
events.description: Thousands of US workers and students marched through cities and campuses Tuesday against President Donald Trump’s policies on the first anniversary of his second term, with demonstrations fueled by outrage over the fatal shooting of 37-year-old Renee Good by federal immigration agents in Minneapolis earlier this month.

events.title: Driver killed in second deadly Spain train crash in days
events.description: At least 37 people have been injured, five seriously, in a second crash, after Sunday's two-train collision in Andalusia.

events.title: Mexico sends 37 more drug cartel suspects to US amid Trump attack threats
events.description: Mexican Security Minister Omar Garcia Harfuch says the US promised that suspects will not face the death penalty.

events.title: Spain suffers second deadly train crash in space of two days
events.description: A train driver has been killed and 37 people injured after a commuter train derailed near Barcelona.

events.title: Gaza humanitarian crisis ‘far from being over,’ UN aid coordination office warns
events.description: Three months into the ceasefire in the Gaza Strip, the UN and partners have delivered tonnes of assistance items and carried out critical repairs, but this is only a temporary “Band-Aid” solution, a veteran aid worker has warned.

events.title: Thousands of workers flee Cambodia scam centres, officials say
events.description: Amnesty International deeply concerned for scores of people ‘walking around in search of assistance’ Thousands of people, including suspected victims of human trafficking, are estimated to have been released or escaped from scam compounds across Cambodia over recent days, after growing international pressure to crackdown on the multibillion-dollar industry. The Indonesian embassy in Phnom Penh said it had received reports from 1,440 of its nationals who had been released from scam centres, while large queues of Chinese nationals were also seen outside the Chinese embassy. Continue reading...

events.title: Ivory Coast will buy unsold cocoa stocks as prices plunge
events.description: Ivory Coast, the world's top cocoa producer, plans to buy unsold cocoa stocks to support farmers as global prices have plunged

events.title: American flags torched, riot police clash with protesters ahead of Trump Davos arrival
events.description: Swiss riots erupt in multiple cities as anti-Trump protesters march against President Trump's World Economic Forum appearance, with police deploying water cannons.

events.title: Iran state TV hacked to show exiled Crown Prince Pahlavi
events.description: Iranian state TV hacked to show exiled Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi urging military to join protesters as death toll reportedly reaches nearly 4,000.

events.title: Colombian ex-paramilitary leader jailed for crimes against Indigenous groups
events.description: Salvatore Mancuso given 40-year sentence, which could be reduced after truth and reparation activities A Colombian court has sentenced a former paramilitary leader to 40 years in prison for crimes committed against Indigenous communities in the province of La Guajira, including homicides, forced disappearances and the displacement of people from 2002 to 2006. The special tribunal that hears cases from the country’s armed conflict said in its ruling that Salvatore Mancuso was responsible for 117 crimes committed by fighters under his command in La Guajira. However, it added that Mancuso’s time in prison could be reduced to eight years, if he collaborated with truth and reparation activities that benefited victims of his former paramilitary group. Continue reading...

events.title: Australia news live: Nationals party room to meet after resignations of frontbenchers who crossed the floor on hate speech
events.description: Follow updates live Coalition under threat as three Nationals senators resign from frontbench after crossing floor Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast CEO of energy company behind Eraring coal power plant says extra two years will help with ‘smooth transition’ Frank Calabria , the CEO of Origin energy, spoke with RN this morning after an announcement Australia’s largest coal-fired power plant, Eraring in New South Wales, would stay open for an additional two years until 2029. A lot of good progress has been made on the transition, a lot of new infrastructure, a lot of new energy assets behind the meter. This will just enable it [to be a] smoother transition. … We’ve made lots of investments, as you would imagine, in large batteries. We’ve got large wind farms underway, so do many other players in the sector. So we’re all aligned about making progress here. Continue reading...

events.title: ‘Shattered’ parents of Canadian backpacker found dead on K’gari island mourn adventurous daughter
events.description: Coroner to examine if 19-year-old drowned off Australian tourist island or was killed by wild dingoes “I’m 18, and you can’t stop me!” Piper James told her father before she set off backpacking on the other side of the Pacific Ocean – but the young Canadian woman’s trip to Australia ended in tragedy and trauma. Early on Monday, the now-19-year-old was found dead on a beach on the world heritage-listed sand island and tourist destination of K’gari (formerly known as Fraser Island) off the Queensland coast, surrounded by a pack of dingoes near the Maheno shipwreck. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump might succeed in breaking up NATO where ten Soviet and Russian leaders tried and failed
events.description: Delano D'Souza welcomes former US Ambassador Mark C. Storella, Professor of the Practice of Diplomacy at Boston University. He offers a sobering analysis of US immigration, and both foreign & economic policies. He warns the US that is not only isolating itself on the global stage, but also undercutting its own economy and moral authority. Authoritarian opportunism, disguised as pragmatism, risks weakening America’s alliances, its values and its democratic norms.

events.title: NATO leaders escalate warnings that Trump's aggression toward Greenland threatens alliance with the US
events.description: NATO leaders escalate warnings that Trump's aggression toward Greenland threatens alliance with the US

events.title: Guterres in London: Humanity strongest when we stand as one
events.description: Powerful forces are lining up to undermine global cooperation, United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres warned at a landmark event in London on Saturday to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the General Assembly, but he urged that “humanity is strongest when we stand as one”.

events.title: World News in Brief: Gaza education update, the General Assembly at 80, Venezuela’s humanitarian needs
events.description: More children in war-ravaged Gaza are now back in the classroom, the UN aid coordination office (OCHA) said on Friday.

events.title: ISIS takes credit for Kabul suicide bombing at Chinese restaurant
events.description: ISIS-K claims responsibility for deadly suicide blast at Chinese restaurant in Kabul, killing seven people, including one Chinese national.

events.title: Philippine coast guard rescues 1 and searches for 12 missing after motorboat vanishes
events.description: Philippine authorities have rescued a crew member from a missing motorboat and are searching for 12 others, including business people

events.title: Aid cuts push millions in West and Central Africa deeper into hunger
events.description: A staggering 55 million people across West and Central Africa are expected to suffer crisis levels of hunger, or worse, during the lean season from June to August as funding cuts to humanitarian operations continue amid rising violence and displacement.

events.title: Illegal immigrant allegedly ran from deadly wrong-way DUI crash that killed motorcyclist, records show
events.description: Deadly wrong-way crash on Tennessee interstate leads to vehicular homicide charges against suspect now held for ICE after allegedly fleeing scene.

events.title: Florida madman stalked tourists near Disney before allegedly killing them in random attack: family
events.description: Three men attending Florida car show allegedly gunned down by neighbor while waiting for rental car assistance. Random shooting shocks community.

events.title: Australian boy fighting for life after shark attack, rescued by friends in Sydney Harbor waters
events.description: A 12-year-old boy is fighting for his life after a catastrophic shark attack in Sydney Harbor. He was rescued by heroic friends who leaped from a cliff to save him.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Transatlantic alliances fray as Trump threatens tariffs regarding Greenland
events.description: Attendees at Davos are steeling themselves for major disruption — not only to the local traffic thanks to heightened security, but possibly to the existing world order.

events.title: Trump leaks world leaders' messages. And, Indiana wins its first national title
events.description: President Trump explains why he wants to acquire Greenland in private messages with world leaders. And, Indiana caps off a perfect football season with a national championship win over Miami.

events.title: After Trump salvo, Macron says: we don't give in to bullies
events.description: The President of France warned against US attempts to "subordinate Europe". Speaking in Davos, Switzerland, Emmanuel Macron blasted as "unacceptable" Trump's threats to impose tariffs of up to 25% on countries opposed to his Greenland takeover plans. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.

events.title: Iran locks nation into ‘darker’ digital blackout, viewing internet as an ‘existential threat’
events.description: Iran enters 22nd day of internet shutdown with limited connectivity restored as NetBlocks reports shift toward "filternet plus" censorship scheme whitelisting only business services.

events.title: Top GOP senator says Syria ceasefire welcome but actions must match words
events.description: Syria reaches fragile ceasefire with Kurdish forces as U.S. senator warns about reported crimes by government troops during military operation against SDF.

events.title: Life sentence for man who killed Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe
events.description: Abe's assassination stunned the country where there is virtually no gun crime.

events.title: Global markets on alert as Europe to suspend approval of US trade deal
events.description: The move follows renewed tensions between the US and EU, as Donald Trump pushes to acquire Greenland.

events.title: US forces seize a seventh Venezuela-linked oil tanker
events.description: US has moved to assert strict control over production and sale of Venezuelan oil since attacking the country this month.

events.title: New Zealand prime minister sets date for 2026 election
events.description: Cost of living likely to dominate the agenda ahead of 7 November poll as centre-right National party battles to retain power The prime minister, Christopher Luxon, has announced New Zealand’s next general election will be held on 7 November, kickstarting a campaign cycle that could become one of the country’s most contested in years. On Wednesday, Luxon told reporters the National party would continue its agenda to “fix the basics and build the future”. Continue reading...

events.title: China sees an opportunity in Greenland, but not in the way that Trump thinks
events.description: For years, Beijing has struggled to gain a foothold in Greenland, in part because of US and Danish unity. Trump’s fraying of that alliance could create the opening it needs According to Kaja Kallas, the European Union’s foreign affairs chief, China and Russia must be having a “ field day ” about Donald Trump’s plans for Greenland, which Kallas says will divide Nato. But according to Trump, his plans are motivated by a desire to counter the very threat that Kallas identified. “World peace is at stake! China and Russia want Greenland, and there is not a thing that Denmark can do about it,” Trump wrote on Truth Social on Saturday. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran warns Trump not to take action against Khamenei
events.description: Iran on Tuesday warned Donald Trump not to take any action against the country's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, days after the U.S. president called for an end to the nearly 40-year reign.

events.title: France's Macron calls on EU to be ready to activate its 'trade bazooka'
events.description: French president Emmanuel Macron spoke out against Donald Trump's latest tariff threat, describing his approach to trade deals as bullying and an attempt to weaken and subordinate Europe. Speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos, the French leader called on the EU to be ready to activate its powerful anti-coercion mechanism, colloquially called the "trade bazooka".

events.title: Nigeria police deny attacks as residents insist 168 people are held by armed groups
events.description: The Nigerian police deny reports of church attacks in Kaduna state over the weekend

events.title: Ukraine's parliament and half of Kyiv with no heating after Russian strikes
events.description: President Zelensky says Russia has started using "far more" ballistic missiles in its attacks on Ukraine.

events.title: Trump's 'Board of Peace' could pose threat to UN
events.description: The UN gave the US president a mandate to lead a "Board of Peace" to stabilize the Middle East. However, Donald Trump seems to be increasingly competing with the UN, while sidelining the Middle East conflict entirely.

events.title: EU vows 'unflinching' response to Trump's Greenland gambit
events.description: European leaders drew a clear line over Greenland Tuesday, vowing an "unflinching" response to Washington's threats even as US President Donald Trump said he was ready to hold a meeting in Davos about his plans to take the autonomous Danish territory. EU chief Ursula von der Leyen warned of relations "plunging into a downward spiral" while Greenland's PM said the island's population must be prepared for military force.

events.title: Spain begins three days of mourning as number killed in train crash could rise
events.description: The number of people killed in a high-speed train crash in Spain could rise in the coming hours as cranes begin moving the wreckage.

events.title: Hopes fade in fourth day of search for dozens missing in Karachi shopping plaza fire
events.description: Hopes of finding survivors of a Karachi shopping plaza fire have faded

events.title: World News in Brief: Food insecurity in Lebanon, Libya migrants freed, UNHCR tackles multiple emergencies – despite cuts
events.description: Since 2026, nearly 17 percent of Lebanon’s population has been living in a state of major food insecurity – a situation that is likely to worsen in the coming year.

events.title: Yemen: Children are dying and it’s going to get worse, warns aid veteran
events.description: In Yemen, renewed political instability and economic woes linked to the war threaten to complicate the already difficult task of helping vulnerable people suffering from deepening hunger, illness and displacement, the UN’s top aid official there said on Monday.

events.title: Peacekeeping: Lacroix warns of rising threats to ‘blue helmets’ in Middle East
events.description: Peacekeeping operations in the Middle East are facing mounting security risks, funding pressures and political uncertainty, the head of UN peacekeeping warned on Friday.

events.title: Leftist pastor calls Minnesota church invasion divine judgment on 'MAGA evangelicals' amid DOJ probe
events.description: Federal officials investigate alleged civil rights violations after ICE protesters disrupted Minnesota church service, sparking Christian debate.

events.title: Top EU official warns Trump's tariff threat over Greenland pushback is 'a mistake'
events.description: EU chief calls President Donald Trump's Greenland tariff threats "a mistake" as European leaders warn of downward spiral in transatlantic trade relations.

events.title: Trump doubles down on Greenland ahead of Davos visit, saying there is 'no going back'
events.description: Trump was due to arrive at the World Economic Forum on Wednesday, but a minor electrical issue on Air Force One has forced his plane to turn around.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Head of US Africa bureau urges staff to highlight US ‘generosity’ despite aid cuts
events.description: Email sent to diplomats by state department office’s new boss is labelled ‘racist’ after dismissing Africa as a priority US diplomats have been encouraged to “unabashedly and aggressively” remind African governments about the “generosity” of the American people, according to a leaked email sent to staff in the US state department’s Bureau of African Affairs this January and obtained by the Guardian. “It’s not gauche to remind these countries of the American people’s generosity in containing HIV/Aids or alleviating famine,” says the email. Continue reading...

events.title: AFCON 2025: Thousands of fans flood the street of Dakar to celebrate victory
events.description: The Senegalese team was welcomed by President Bassirou Diomaye Faye before parading through the streets of Dakar.

events.title: Fans flood Dakar streets for Senegal’s jubilant AFCON victory parade
events.description: The streets of Dakar were packed with thousands of Senegal football fans on Tuesday as the Lions of Teranga held a parade to celebrate their victory in the Africa Cup of Nations final against Morocco. The win marked Senegal's second title, after their 2022 victory over Egypt in Cameroon.

events.title: How has Trump's one year in office weighed on the war in Ukraine?
events.description: FRANCE 24's Kyiv correspondent Gulliver Cragg reflects on how, one year into Donald Trump's second mandate, the support of the United States for Ukraine has waned, although, as he points out, the US president has not 'entirely' taken Russia's side.

events.title: UN strongly condemns demolition of UNRWA headquarters in East Jerusalem
events.description: The reported demolition underway early Tuesday of the headquarters of UN agency UNRWA by Israeli forces in occupied East Jerusalem - reportedly “under the watch of lawmakers and a member of the Government” - has prompted swift condemnation from the global body.

events.title: Shock and confusion as Spain struggles for answers after deadly train crash
events.description: Investigators remain baffled by the cause of Sunday's deadly crash in the south of the country.

events.title: US Justice Department probes Minnesota officials amid migration raids
events.description: Investigation will look into whether Minnesota officials blocked federal immigration agents from carrying out duties.

events.title: Cause of death revealed weeks after woman died following Universal Orlando ride: report
events.description: Authorities released the identity and cause of death of a 70-year-old woman months after she died following a ride on Universal Orlando’s Revenge of the Mummy roller coaster.

events.title: Lyse Doucet: Trump is shaking the world order more than any president since WW2
events.description: Trump's demands over Greenland are a rude awakening in a moment fraught with risk.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: UK approves Chinese ‘mega embassy’ in London after reassurances from spy chiefs
events.description: Critics expected to mount legal challenge to plans for vast complex at Royal Mint Court amid security concerns The communities secretary, Steve Reed, has given permission for China to build a vast new embassy near the Tower of London after spy chiefs told him that the risks to UK national security could be controlled and dealt with. The decision paves the way for Keir Starmer to visit Beijing in the coming weeks – though local residents plan to legally challenge the decision, potentially delaying the development by months or years. Continue reading...

events.title: Live: France calls for NATO exercise in Greenland
events.description: France has called for a NATO exercise to be held in Greenland, the French presidential office said on Wednesday. The proposal comes as world leaders gather at the World Economic Meeting in Davos, where US President Donald Trump is expected to continue to push for his “need” to take control of the autonomous Danish territory. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.

events.title: Mexico sends 37 cartel members to US in latest offer to Trump administration
events.description: Mexico's security minister says the country has sent 37 more cartel members to the United States

events.title: South Sudan president fires interior minister in a move threatening peace agreement
events.description: President Salva Kiir of South Sudan has dismissed his interior minister, Angelina Teny, who is the wife of detained opposition leader Riek Machar

events.title: Trump floats ‘Board of Peace’ to replace UN, signals major global power shift
events.description: President Donald Trump invited dozens of countries including Russia, China, and Ukraine to join his Board of Peace initiative, with a signing ceremony planned for Davos, Switzerland.

events.title: Second lady Usha Vance announces she is pregnant with fourth child
events.description: Vance posted on social media that she is looking forward to welcoming a boy in late July.

events.title: Australia parliament passes gun reform and anti-hate bills after Bondi shooting
events.description: The reforms are in response to Australia's worst mass shooting in decades at a Jewish festival in December.

events.title: Israel’s wanted war criminal Netanyahu joins Gaza ‘board of peace’
events.description: This is a breaking news story.

events.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,427
events.description: These are the key developments from day 1,427 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

events.title: Vinicius defies boos with star turn in Real Madrid’s 6-1 UCL rout of Monaco
events.description: Real Madrid beat Monaco 6-1 in the league phase of the Champions League, as forward Vinicius defies boos from home fans.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Yoweri Museveni wins Ugandan election as opponent condemns ‘fake result’
events.description: Museveni’s opponent, Bobi Wine, alleges that members of polling staff were kidnapped and called for peaceful protests Yoweri Museveni, has won the Ugandan election and his seventh term with more than 70% of the vote, state election authorities have said, amid an internet shutdown and claims of fraud by his opponent. His opponent, a youthful musician known as Bobi Wine, condemned what he called “fake results” and alleged that members of polling staff were kidnapped, among other election irregularities. He called for peaceful protests to pressure the authorities to release what he called the “rightful results”. Continue reading...

events.title: 'The miracle': A 6-year-old walked away from the train wreck that killed her family
events.description: Her parents, brother and cousin were killed in the collision, but the girl was found walking barefoot on the tracks. She's being cared for by grandparents after receiving three stitches in her head.

events.title: South Korea jails ex-PM Han Duck-soo over martial law crisis
events.description: A South Korean court has delivered a lengthy prison sentence to a former prime minister over his role in the political turmoil triggered by ex-President Yoon Suk Yeol declaring martial law over a year ago.

events.title: WEF: Is Greenland the wake-up call Europe needed?
events.description: Europe faces waning influence amid wars, trade tensions, climate inaction and a US administration quick to hurl insults at its oldest allies. In Davos, leaders discuss how Europe can regain its mojo.

events.title: China stays resilient in first year of Trump 2.0
events.description: Donald Trump's second term in the White House has tested China's tit-for-tat approach in response to the the US president's trade war. While stiff competition remains moving forward, there are signs of more stable ties.

events.title: One year of Trump 2.0: how he's weaponised AI as political propaganda
events.description: As Donald Trump marks one year back in the White House, Vedika Bahl takes a closer look at how he has weaponised artificial intelligence into a top political tool, used to glorify himself, attack his opponents and amplify his political agenda. Whilst it has become a defining feature of his digital presence, it's brought with it a new frontier for misinformation and fake news.

events.title: Man who killed former Japanese PM Shinzo Abe jailed for life
events.description: A man has been sentenced to life in prison for assassinating former Japanese prime minister Shinzo Abe, according to public broadcaster NHK.

events.title: Surfer 'lucky to survive' Sydney's fourth shark attack in three days
events.description: A surfer has become the latest victim of a shark attack in Australia - the fourth off Sydney in just three days.

events.title: Australia fast-tracks tougher gun and hate laws after Bondi Beach shooting
events.description: Australia's politicians have fast-tracked reforms to toughen gun control and hate crime laws in response to December's Bondi Beach shooting.

events.title: UN rights chief bears witness to trauma and resilience in Sudan
events.description: Nearly three years of war have plunged Sudan “into an abyss of unimaginable dimensions” and human rights must be at the centre of efforts to end the fighting and build lasting peace, the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights said on Sunday in Nairobi.

events.title: Missouri couple accused of locking teens in chicken pen, shooting them with BB guns in abuse case
events.description: A Missouri couple is accused of locking teens in a chicken pen and shooting them with BB guns in an alleged abuse case. Both were arrested and held without bond.

events.title: Indiana judge in bizarre Natalia Grace case shot in home attack as police hunt suspect
events.description: Indiana judge who presided over controversial Natalia Grace case allegedly shot at home by unknown suspect. Both judge and wife in stable condition.

events.title: Minnesota police chiefs allege some ICE agents racially profiled US citizens, including off-duty officers
events.description: Minnesota police chiefs report federal immigration officers allegedly racially profiled American citizens and off-duty cops during enforcement operations.

events.title: Suspect uttered 4 words before shooting Indiana judge and wife: dispatch audio
events.description: A shooter shot a Lafayette judge and his wife at their home before fleeing the scene. Steven and Kimberly Meyer are stable as the manhunt continues in Indiana.

events.title: US drug overdose deaths plummet 20% as Trump administration cracks down on southern border
events.description: Drug overdose deaths plummeted over 20% as border enforcement tightened, new CDC data shows. Experts suggest stronger policies may curb fentanyl flow.

events.title: Portland police release photos of suspect accused of shooting 2 officers
events.description: The Portland Police Bureau released photos of a suspect who allegedly shot two officers on Monday night, describing him as "armed and dangerous."

events.title: Nanny love triangle murders trial pits dueling stories of mastermind behind case ‘out of a TV movie’: expert
events.description: First week of testimony in Virginia murder trial exposes alleged affair between Brendan Banfield and family nanny, leading to wife's death and cover-up.

events.title: Fourth shark attack in three days rocks Australia as authorities close beaches and deploy drumlines
events.description: A string of shark attacks near Sydney prompted beach closures across New South Wales. The latest victim attacked at Point Plomer suffered only minor cuts.

events.title: Kim Jong-un fires vice-premier and likens him to ‘a goat yoked to an ox cart’
events.description: North Korean leader reportedly blames Yang Sung-ho for ‘confusion’ at factory project as major congress looms The North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un , has dismissed a vice-premier over troubles in a factory modernisation project, in an apparent move to tighten discipline among officials and push them to deliver greater results before a major political conference. The upcoming ruling Workers’ party congress, the first of its kind in five years , is one of North Korea’s biggest propaganda spectacles and is intended to review past projects, establish new political and economic priorities and reshuffle officials. Continue reading...

events.title: Japan jails ex-PM Shinzo Abe assassin for life after guilty verdict in 2022 killing
events.description: The gunman charged with killing Japan’s former prime minister Shinzo Abe was found guilty and sentenced to life in prison on Wednesday, more than three years after the brazen daylight assassination shocked the country. Judge Shinichi Tanaka handed down the ruling at a court in the city of Nara.

events.title: US veteran gets 5 years in Russian prison after authorities reportedly force him to dock with firearm onboard
events.description: U.S. Navy veteran Charles Wayne Zimmerman was sentenced to 5 years in Russian prison after allegedly failing to declare a firearm oboard his yacht in Sochi port.

events.title: UK defends Chagos deal after Trump calls it 'act of great stupidity'
events.description: The US president says it is "another in a very long line of National Security reasons why Greenland has to be acquired".

events.title: New Zealand PM Christopher Luxon calls national election for November 7
events.description: New Zealanders are set to go to the polls later this year amid a sluggish economy and rising unemployment.

events.title: What is Bangladesh’s Jamaat-e-Islami party? Could it lead the country next?
events.description: For first time in its chequered history, the party has a real chance of grabbing power as the leader of ruling alliance.

events.title: Trump made many statements on US economy. Most are untrue
events.description: In address to media on Tuesday, US president made many false claims, including that there was 'no inflation' in the US.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Kurds vs. Syrian government troops: What you need to know
events.description: Syria's government is trying to forcefully absorb a Syrian Kurdish paramilitary group that once controlled much of the country's northeast. The fight ultimately comes down to a clash about Syria's future governance.

events.title: Venezuela to use US-brokered oil sale to boost battered currency
events.description: Venezuela’s interim president Delcy Rodriguez confirmed Tuesday that her country would start using revenues from a US-brokered oil sale to prop up the bolivar against the dollar. Rodriguez has also appointed US-educated banker Calixto Ortega to head the country’s main investment agency, in a move seen as an overture to US investors after Nicolas Maduro’s ouster.

events.title: One year after Trump’s inauguration, US–Africa policy has changed fundamentally
events.description: In tonight's edition, one year after Donald Trump took office in the White House, has Washington reset its relationship with Africa? Also, Ghana arrests West African nationals accused of illegal online activities, luring workers under the pretext of lucrative work and forcing them to engage in cyber crimes. And new Africa Cup of Nations champions receive a true hero's welcome in Senegal.

events.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un dismisses vice premier, comparing him to 'a goat yoked to pull an ox cart'
events.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has dismissed a vice premier over a factory modernisation project in a rare public rebuke ahead of a ruling party congress, state media has reported.

events.title: Human trafficking depends on corruption at every step
events.description: In 2011, a trafficker in Chile was convicted for recruiting economically vulnerable Peruvian citizens and arranging for them to be brought into the country – destined to become victims of sexual exploitation.

events.title: Locked exits, panic and desperate calls for help: Survivors tell of mall fire horror
events.description: The BBC speaks to eyewitnesses and survivors of the fire that ripped through a busy Pakistan shopping centre.

events.title: Alleged scam mastermind arrested after being exposed by BBC
events.description: Kuong Li featured in a 2023 BBC Eye investigation into alleged scam compounds in South East Asia.

events.title: New ceasefire in Syria after Kurdish-led forces pull out of camp for IS families
events.description: The government announces a four-day ceasefire with the SDF, which says it was "compelled" to withdraw its fighters from al-Hol camp.

events.title: Turkiye’s Sonmez storms into Australian Open 2026 third round
events.description: Zeynep Sonmez wins in straight sets to enter the third round of a Grand Slam for the second time in six months.

events.title: Palestinians in Gaza confront reality behind ceasefire’s second phase
events.description: Hopes for new Gaza administration clash with reality as Israeli control over crossings keeps aid flowing at a slow pace.

events.title: Stock markets, dollar plunge as Trump ramps up tensions over Greenland
events.description: Wall Street has its worst day since October as Trump doubles down on threats to take Greenland.

events.title: Germany sees thousands join pro-Kurdish protests
events.description: German cities saw large pro-Kurdish demonstrations on Tuesday as Syrian government troops clash with Kurdish forces in northeastern Syria.

events.title: Davos 2026: 'We prefer respect to bullies,' Macron says
events.description: France's president said it was "fundamentally unacceptable" for the US to use tariff threats as "leverage against territorial sovereignty." His speech came ahead of US President Trump's visit to Davos. DW has more.

events.title: 'A lot of rosy rhetoric, but the jobs numbers are just not there for Trump'
events.description: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Mark Owen, Gavin Bade, reporter on trade and economic policy at The Wall Street Journal, says that Donald Trump's tariffs policy may be 'already coming back to bite the US' and that over 70,000 jobs have been lost since the tariffs announcement in April 2025.

events.title: As fires in Chile burn, a mobile clinic fights to save furry survivors
events.description: Veterinarians and volunteers in Chile are racing to help animals affected by devastating fires

events.title: Barcelona commuter train crashes Tuesday night, two days after deadly train collision in Spain
events.description: Barcelona commuter train crashes Tuesday night, two days after deadly train collision in Spain

events.title: Six-year-old girl the sole survivor of a family that perished in Spanish train wreck
events.description: A 6-year-old girl has survived Sunday's deadly train crash in southern Spain

events.title: Internet shutdown squeezes Iran's ailing businesses already hurt by crashing currency
events.description: Iranians have been struggling with a near-total internet blackout for nearly two weeks

events.title: Ukraine: Families in ‘survival mode’ amid Russian strikes and deadly cold
events.description: Families across Ukraine are in “constant survival mode” amid ongoing waves of Russian missile and drone strikes that have left blocks without power for days at a time, while temperatures plunge to deadly lows, the UN Children's Fund (UNICEF) said on Friday.

events.title: Minnesota pastor condemns anti-ICE agitators who interrupted service: ‘Shameful and unlawful’
events.description: Anti-ICE protesters allegedly disrupted Minneapolis church service, shouting at parishioners in viral video. Pastor condemns 'shameful' intimidation.

events.title: US Marshals nab fugitive hiding under child's bed: officials
events.description: Fugitive found hiding under child's bed during dramatic U.S. Marshals arrest operation in Spokane. Authorities said suspect was wanted on firearm charges.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: ‘Outrageous’: EPA backs WA fracking project that may add up to 2.6% to Australia’s emissions
events.description: State environmental regulator says Valhalla project, set to drill up to 20 gas wells in Canning basin, can proceed subject to conditions Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A controversial fracking proposal in Western Australia’s Kimberley region has been recommended for approval by the state’s Environmental Protection Authority, a move criticised as “outrageous” due to the project’s potential climate pollution and environmental impacts. The EPA on Tuesday recommended that the Valhalla project, which proposes to drill up to 20 gas wells in the Canning basin, proceed subject to certain conditions. Continue reading...

events.title: Syria: Kurdish forces leave IS camp as army advances
events.description: The Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces said they had to withdraw from al-Hol camp, which holds thousands of relatives of Islamic State fighters, to redeploy elsewhere. It's the second such pullout in as many days.

events.title: Syrian military claims that Kurdish-led forces abandoned camp housing families of Islamic State militants
events.description: Syrian military claims that Kurdish-led forces abandoned camp housing families of Islamic State militants

events.title: Syrian interior ministry: 120 Islamic State group members escape from prison amid clashes
events.description: Syria's interior ministry says 120 Islamic State group members have escaped from a prison in northeast Syria

events.title: ISIS fighters break free from Syrian jail amid chaotic government handover
events.description: U.S. military boosts regional presence with F-15 fighter jets and USS Abraham Lincoln deployment as ISIS prison break highlights security risks amid Syria's political realignment.

events.title: Gunmen abduct dozens of worshippers from multiple Nigerian churches using sophisticated weapons
events.description: Gunmen allegedly abducted dozens of worshippers from two churches in Nigeria's Kaduna state, with security forces deployed to track the captors.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: ASEAN won't endorse election in military-ruled Myanmar, Malaysia says
events.description: Malaysia's foreign minister Mohamad Hasan cited concerns over the lack of inclusive and free participation.

events.title: EU prosecutor: Third of VAT fraud cases linked to Slovakia
events.description: The EU's most senior prosecutor told Slovak MPs that a staggering one in three VAT fraud cases investigated by her office has links to Slovakia. How can such fraud flourish in Slovakia and is it a new problem?

events.title: Prison breaks and renewed clashes raise alarm in northeast Syria
events.description: The United Nations continues to monitor developments in northeast Syria following clashes between government troops and the Kurdish-led SDF militia during which scores of detained ISIL militants reportedly escaped from prison.

events.title: American chess prodigy had multiple drugs in system when found dead amid cheating controversy: report
events.description: Chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky was found dead with multiple drugs in his system after being accused of cheating, a toxicology report reveals.

events.title: Trump told to 'f--- off' by Danish lawmaker during European Parliament debate about Greenland
events.description: European Parliament member Anders Vistisen confronts President Donald Trump's Greenland interest with profanity-laced rebuke, drawing a reprimand from parliament leadership.

events.title: Nigerian police confirm gunmen abducted villagers, after initial denials
events.description: The head of a Christian church alliance says 172 people were kidnapped by armed men, and that nine later escaped.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Champions League: Man City humiliated as holders PSG stumble and Arsenal stay perfect
events.description: Manchester City suffered one of the biggest shocks in Champions League history on Tuesday, losing 3-1 at Norway’s Bodo/Glimt, while holders Paris Saint-Germain were beaten late by Sporting Lisbon. Gabriel Jesus struck as Arsenal stayed perfect in the league phase.

events.title: Beckham vs Peltz Beckham: Could Brooklyn torpedo the family brand?
events.description: Brooklyn's explosive post about Brand Beckham "has ruptured it from within", one commentator says.

events.title: Spat deepens between Elon Musk and Ryanair's O'Leary
events.description: Musk and Ryanair boss Michael O'Leary have called each other "idiots" in recent days

events.title: Colombia sentences ex-paramilitary leader Mancuso to 40 years in jail
events.description: Salvatore Mancuso's group committed more than 100 crimes, many targeting an indigenous group, the tribunal ruled.

events.title: Ex-president accused of murder plot extradited to Burkina Faso
events.description: Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba has not commented on the accusations from Burkina Faso.

events.title: Cow astonishes scientists with rare use of tools
events.description: The discovery suggests cows may have far greater cognitive abilities than previously assumed.

events.title: France makes first interception targeting small boat crossings to UK
events.description: The operation follows a change of tactics agreed amid growing pressure from the UK government to step up interventions.

events.title: 'Europe is at a total loss': Russia gloats over Greenland tensions
events.description: The BBC's Russia editor Steve Rosenberg analyses why pro-Russian government papers are full of praise for Donald Trump's desire to buy Greenland.

events.title: US approves $2.3bn sale of torpedoes, air defences, aircraft to Singapore
events.description: Singapore's Ministry of Defence plans to replace its fleet of Fokker 50 Maritime Patrol Aircraft with Boeing planes.

events.title: Air Force One turned back as it carried Trump to Davos
events.description: US president resumed journey to Europe on Boeing 757 that departed just after midnight on Wednesday.

events.title: US trade with Southeast Asia and Taiwan surging despite Trump tariffs
events.description: While trade data show exports from China have fallen dramatically, US customers are still buying from elsewhere.

events.title: Ex-Japanese Prime Minister Abe’s killer sentenced to life
events.description: Tetsuya Yamagami shot the Japanese politician dead in 2022.

events.title: ‘You’ll find out’: Key takeaways from Trump’s one-year anniversary remarks
events.description: At a White House news briefing, Trump expressed optimism about his prospects of claiming Greenland for the US.

events.title: Jesus brace helps Arsenal down Inter to seal Champions League qualification
events.description: Arsenal win 3-1 at Inter Milan in the league phase of the UEFA Champions League to seal their place in the last 16.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Confidence runs high in London’s Little Morocco as Afcon glory beckons
events.description: Atlas Lions face Senegal in final of Africa Cup of Nations on Sunday and Moroccan diaspora scents victory London’s Little Morocco is brimming with pride and anticipation. The Moroccan diaspora in North Kensington is in no doubt that on Sunday the Atlas Lions will triumph against Senegal in the final of the Africa Cup of Nations. “There’s not just an excitement, it has completely taken over everything else,” said Souad Talsi, who runs the Al-Hasaniya Moroccan women’s centre at the base of 31-storey Trellick Tower, at the north end of Golborne Road. Continue reading...

events.title: Tight spot: cheapest spray takes first place in Choice stain remover test
events.description: Aldi triumphed in the consumer watchdog’s laundry showdown, while some name brands failed to come out in the wash Get our weekend culture and lifestyle email The cheapest laundry stain removal spray from a major Australian supermarket is also one of the best-performing products in the field, according to a product test by consumer advocacy group Choice. Choice tested 23 stain remover powders and 20 pre-treater sprays on common garment stains caused by sweat, grass and mud, and cooking oil, as well as stubborn stains from chocolate ice-cream, tomato, baby food, blood and makeup. Sign up for the fun stuff with our rundown of must-reads, pop culture and tips for the weekend, every Saturday morning Continue reading...

events.title: Israel's Netanyahu agrees to join Trump's Board of Peace
events.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said Wednesday he had agreed to join U.S. President Donald Trump's Board of Peace, after his office earlier criticized makeup of the board.

events.title: Trump says U.K. return of Chagos Islands to Mauritius is reason to acquire Greenland
events.description: The president previously supported Britain's agreement to hand back sovereignty of the Indian Ocean archipelago, where the U.K. continues to lease the U.S.-U.K. Diego Garcia military base.

events.title: China's birth rate fell to a record low last year despite attempts to boost it
events.description: Despite government efforts to boost fertility, China's birth rate fell to a record low in 2025.

events.title: Trump's Board of Peace has several invited leaders trying to figure out how it'll work
events.description: It's unclear how many leaders have been asked to join the board, and the large number of invitations being sent out, including to countries that don't get along, has raised questions about the board's mandate and decision-making processes.

events.title: Japan: Assassin of ex-PM Shinzo Abe jailed for life
events.description: The man who shot ex-Japan PM Shinzo Abe with a handmade gun in 2022 is due to spend his life in prison. The killer, Tetsuya Yamagami, said his actions were fueled by anger over the controversial Unification Church.

events.title: Chile's president-elect picks Pinochet lawyers as ministers
events.description: Chilean President-elect Jose Antonio Kast has named two lawyers who defended dictator Augusto Pinochet to his new cabinet. The far-right leader said his picks were "not the result of quotas, calculations or pressure."

events.title: Elon Musk mulls buying Ryanair amid spat with airline boss
events.description: Elon Musk has asked his followers on X if he should buy Ryanair after a spat with the European budget airline's outspoken CEO Michael O'Leary.

events.title: Venezuela receives $300M in proceeds from first US oil sale
events.description: Interim president Delcy Rodriguez said the money from US sales of Venezuelan oil will be used to prop up the currency.

events.title: 'We'll work something out,' Trump says of Greenland row
events.description: While insisting the US needs control of Greenland, US President Trump was confident "something is going to happen that is going to be good for everybody" regarding tension between the US and Europe. Follow DW for more.

events.title: Israel demolishes structures inside UNRWA compound
events.description: Israel banned the UN agency for Palestinian refugees last year, claiming it had been infiltrated by militants, a charge the United Nations strongly denies.

events.title: Germany updates: Majority of Germans reject Teslas
events.description: In a recent survey, some 60% of Germans said buying a Tesla was "completely out of the question," Meanwhile, the German military has filled its ranks to the highest levels in over a decade.

events.title: High inflation in Nigeria weighs heavily on everyday life
events.description: Nigerians are grappling with rising inflation, particularly in food prices, driven by subsidy cuts. President Bola Tinubu's government hopes that such measures will improve the situation in the long term.

events.title: US military seizes seventh Venezuela-linked tanker amid Trump oil crackdown
events.description: US military forces boarded and seized a seventh oil tanker linked to Venezuela, the US Southern Command said on Tuesday, as the administration of President Donald Trump steps up efforts to curb Caracas’s oil exports. The MV Sagitta was apprehended without incident, the command said.

events.title: Trump has a 'unique, sometimes strange affinity' with Vladimir Putin
events.description: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney, Thomas Graham, Distinguished Fellow at the Council on Foreign Relations, says that the relationship between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin is based on a 'unique, sometimes strange affinity that president Trump appears to have for strongmen, president Putin in particular', adding that Trump has 'found it very difficult to translate it into hard policy that actually advances American interests'.

events.title: How has Trump reshaped the White House?
events.description: FRANCE 24's Monte Francis takes a look at how Donald Trump has reshaped the White House, and not just in terms of ripping down the East Wing without planning permission to build a ballroom.

events.title: 'He was bleeding for 40 minutes, gasping for life'
events.description: "The beat is pounding as he delivers a verse, in a home-made studio built in the closet. I'm not here on a trial run - I'm going to reach the peak - streets, nights, beats, they're my oxygen."

events.title: Trump offers ominous message on Greenland ahead of crunch talks with European leaders
events.description: Donald Trump will address European leaders in Switzerland today after again refusing to rule out using military force to take Greenland.

events.title: As Trump brands decision 'act of great stupidity' - what is in the Chagos Islands deal?
events.description: Donald Trump has slammed the UK's decision to hand the Chagos Islands to Mauritius, in a deal that includes a formal transfer of Diego Garcia, home to a key US military base.

events.title: Man who assassinated former Japanese prime minister gets life in prison
events.description: A Japanese court sentenced a man who admitted assassinating former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe to life imprisonment, according to NHK public television

events.title: Colombia slashes wages for its legislators
events.description: Colombia’s president on Tuesday reduced wages for members of Congress by approximately 30%, as the South American nation faces a budget crunch and gets ready to hold elections in the first semester of this year

events.title: Families of Venezuelan prisoners demand their release after weeks of waiting outside prisons
events.description: Families of Venezuelan prisoners are demanding the release of nearly 800 detained critics, journalists and opposition members

events.title: What to know about the Chagos Islands as Trump slams the UK's sovereignty deal
events.description: President Trump has criticized a deal between Britain and Mauritius over the Chagos Islands, calling it "an act of GREAT STUPIDITY."

events.title: UK approves a ‘mega’ Chinese Embassy in London despite criticism of security risks
events.description: Britain's government has approved a massive new Chinese Embassy in central London

events.title: ASEAN won't endorse election in military-ruled Myanmar, Malaysia says
events.description: Malaysia-s foreign minister says The Association of Southeast Asian Nations will not endorse elections in military-ruled Myanmar

events.title: Surgeon ex-husband extradited to Ohio in slaying of dentist and wife
events.description: Ex-husband allegedly behind Columbus double murder extradited to Ohio. McKee accused of killing dentist Spencer Tepe and wife Monique in shocking crime.

events.title: Native American group vows Supreme Court fight over woke New York mascot ban
events.description: Native American advocacy group prepares to take constitutional fight over school name bans to Supreme Court, arguing New York's rule violates 14th Amendment rights.

events.title: Anti-ICE agitator defends invading church, claims 'it's what needed to be done'
events.description: Anti-ICE agitators disrupted a Minnesota church service, with a Black Lives Matter leader claiming it "needed to be done" after a pastor was linked to ICE.

events.title: Video shows anti-ICE agitator berating Christians in Minnesota church service
events.description: An anti-U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement agitator berated churchgoers during a service at Cities Church in Minneapolis on Sunday.

events.title: US forces apprehend sanctioned vessel in Caribbean maritime operation targeting illicit oil transport
events.description: U.S. military forces apprehended Motor Vessel Sagitta in the Caribbean as part of Operation Southern Spear targeting sanctioned tanker vessels.

events.title: Trump confirms he invited Putin to join his Board of Peace: 'He's been invited'
events.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday confirmed Russian President Vladimir Putin was invited to the Board of Peace for supervision of the Gaza plan.

events.title: Denmark ramps up defenses in Greenland as Trump zeros in on control of territory
events.description: Denmark deploys additional troops to Greenland after President Donald Trump claims the island is not secure from Russia or China.
